greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ackermann function, defined recursively by A(0,n) = n+1, A(m+1,0) = A(m,1), A(m+1,n+1) = A(m,A(m+1,n)) for any nonnegative integers n, m. Table read by antidiagonals, the second term being A(0,1).
comment: This is a computable function that is not primitive recursive.
reference: R. Peter, Rekursive Funktionen in der Komputer-Theorie. Budapest: Akad. Kiado, 1951.
link: W. Ackermann, Zum Hilbertschen Aufbau der reellen Zahlen, Math. Ann. 99 (1928), 118-133.
R. C. Buck, Mathematical induction and recursive definitions, Amer. Math. Monthly, 70 (1963), 128-135.
formula: A(4,n) = 2^^(n+3)- 3 (a power tower of n+3 two's).
results.author: _Benoit Jubin_, Sep 01 2008
